abstract: Debt crisis in Puerto Rico revives calls for commonwealth's independence, with Gov Alejandro J Garcia Padilla going so far as to seek help from United Nations in achieving self-determination; many nationalists feel seven-member panel appointed by Obama administration and Congress to oversee island and its finances reeks of colonialism.

headline.print_headline: Puerto Rico’s Financial Woes  Revive Calls for Independence
headline.main: Puerto Rico’s Financial Woes Revive Calls for Independence

snippet: To longtime nationalists, moves by the United States over the island’s $72 billion debt are yet more proof that colonialism is alive and well....
lead_paragraph: To longtime nationalists, moves by the United States over the island’s $72 billion debt are yet more proof that colonialism is alive and well.
